67  /**
68   * Export the specified snapshot to a given FileSystem.
69   *
70   * The .snapshot/name folder is copied to the destination cluster
71   * and then all the hfiles/hlogs are copied using a Map-Reduce Job in the .archive/ location.
72   * When everything is done, the second cluster can restore the snapshot.
73   */
74  @InterfaceAudience.Public
75  @InterfaceStability.Evolving
76  public final class ExportSnapshot extends Configured implements Tool {
77    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(ExportSnapshot.class);
78  
79    private static final String CONF_FILES_USER = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.user";
80    private static final String CONF_FILES_GROUP = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.group";
81    private static final String CONF_FILES_MODE = "snapshot.export.files.attributes.mode";
82    private static final String CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY = "snapshot.export.checksum.verify";
83    private static final String CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT = "snapshot.export.output.root";
84    private static final String CONF_INPUT_ROOT = "snapshot.export.input.root";
85  
86    static final String CONF_TEST_FAILURE = "test.snapshot.export.failure";
87    static final String CONF_TEST_RETRY = "test.snapshot.export.failure.retry";
88  
89    private static final String INPUT_FOLDER_PREFIX = "export-files.";
90  
91    // Export Map-Reduce Counters, to keep track of the progress
92    public enum Counter { MISSING_FILES, COPY_FAILED, BYTES_EXPECTED, BYTES_COPIED };
93  
94    private static class ExportMapper extends Mapper<Text, NullWritable, NullWritable, NullWritable> {
95      final static int REPORT_SIZE = 1 * 1024 * 1024;
96      final static int BUFFER_SIZE = 64 * 1024;
97  
98      private boolean testFailures;
99      private Random random;
100 
101     private boolean verifyChecksum;
102     private String filesGroup;
103     private String filesUser;
104     private short filesMode;
105 
106     private FileSystem outputFs;
107     private Path outputArchive;
108     private Path outputRoot;
109 
110     private FileSystem inputFs;
111     private Path inputArchive;
112     private Path inputRoot;
113 
114     @Override
115     public void setup(Context context) {
116       Configuration conf = context.getConfiguration();
117       verifyChecksum = conf.getBoolean(CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY, true);
118 
119       filesGroup = conf.get(CONF_FILES_GROUP);
120       filesUser = conf.get(CONF_FILES_USER);
121       filesMode = (short)conf.getInt(CONF_FILES_MODE, 0);
122       outputRoot = new Path(conf.get(CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT));
123       inputRoot = new Path(conf.get(CONF_INPUT_ROOT));
124 
125       inputArchive = new Path(inputRoot, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
126       outputArchive = new Path(outputRoot, HConstants.HFILE_ARCHIVE_DIRECTORY);
127 
128       testFailures = conf.getBoolean(CONF_TEST_FAILURE, false);
129 
130       try {
131         inputFs = FileSystem.get(inputRoot.toUri(), conf);
132       } catch (IOException e) {
133         throw new RuntimeException("Could not get the input FileSystem with root=" + inputRoot, e);
134       }
135 
136       try {
137         outputFs = FileSystem.get(outputRoot.toUri(), conf);
138       } catch (IOException e) {
139         throw new RuntimeException("Could not get the output FileSystem with root="+ outputRoot, e);
140       }
141     }
142 
143     @Override
144     public void map(Text key, NullWritable value, Context context)
145         throws InterruptedException, IOException {
146       Path inputPath = new Path(key.toString());
147       Path outputPath = getOutputPath(inputPath);
148 
149       LOG.info("copy file input=" + inputPath + " output=" + outputPath);
150       copyFile(context, inputPath, outputPath);
151       LOG.info("copy completed for input=" + inputPath + " output=" + outputPath);
152     }
153 
154     /**
155      * Returns the location where the inputPath will be copied.
156      *  - hfiles are encoded as hfile links hfile-region-table
157      *  - logs are encoded as serverName/logName
158      */
159     private Path getOutputPath(final Path inputPath) throws IOException {
160       Path path;
161       if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(inputPath) || StoreFileInfo.isReference(inputPath)) {
162         String family = inputPath.getParent().getName();
163         TableName table =
164             HFileLink.getReferencedTableName(inputPath.getName());
165         String region = HFileLink.getReferencedRegionName(inputPath.getName());
166         String hfile = HFileLink.getReferencedHFileName(inputPath.getName());
167         path = new Path(FSUtils.getTableDir(new Path("./"), table),
168             new Path(region, new Path(family, hfile)));
169       } else if (isHLogLinkPath(inputPath)) {
170         String logName = inputPath.getName();
171         path = new Path(new Path(outputRoot, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME), logName);
172       } else {
173         path = inputPath;
174       }
175       return new Path(outputArchive, path);
176     }
177 
178     /*
179      * Used by TestExportSnapshot to simulate a failure
180      */
181     private void injectTestFailure(final Context context, final Path inputPath)
182         throws IOException {
183       if (testFailures) {
184         if (context.getConfiguration().getBoolean(CONF_TEST_RETRY, false)) {
185           if (random == null) {
186             random = new Random();
187           }
188 
189           // FLAKY-TEST-WARN: lower is better, we can get some runs without the
190           // retry, but at least we reduce the number of test failures due to
191           // this test exception from the same map task.
192           if (random.nextFloat() < 0.03) {
193             throw new IOException("TEST RETRY FAILURE: Unable to copy input=" + inputPath
194                                   + " time=" + System.currentTimeMillis());
195           }
196         } else {
197           context.getCounter(Counter.COPY_FAILED).increment(1);
198           throw new IOException("TEST FAILURE: Unable to copy input=" + inputPath);
199         }
200       }
201     }
202 
203     private void copyFile(final Context context, final Path inputPath, final Path outputPath)
204         throws IOException {
205       injectTestFailure(context, inputPath);
206 
207       FSDataInputStream in = openSourceFile(inputPath);
208       if (in == null) {
209         context.getCounter(Counter.MISSING_FILES).increment(1);
210         throw new FileNotFoundException(inputPath.toString());
211       }
212 
213       try {
214         // Verify if the input file exists
215         FileStatus inputStat = getFileStatus(inputFs, inputPath);
216         if (inputStat == null) {
217           context.getCounter(Counter.MISSING_FILES).increment(1);
218           throw new FileNotFoundException(inputPath.toString());
219         }
220 
221         // Verify if the output file exists and is the same that we want to copy
222         if (outputFs.exists(outputPath)) {
223           FileStatus outputStat = outputFs.getFileStatus(outputPath);
224           if (sameFile(inputStat, outputStat)) {
225             LOG.info("Skip copy " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath + ", same file.");
226             return;
227           }
228         }
229 
230         context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_EXPECTED).increment(inputStat.getLen());
231 
232         // Ensure that the output folder is there and copy the file
233         outputFs.mkdirs(outputPath.getParent());
234         FSDataOutputStream out = outputFs.create(outputPath, true);
235         try {
236           copyData(context, inputPath, in, outputPath, out, inputStat.getLen());
237         } finally {
238           out.close();
239         }
240 
241         // Preserve attributes
242         preserveAttributes(outputPath, inputStat);
243       } finally {
244         in.close();
245       }
246     }
247 
248     /**
249      * Preserve the files attribute selected by the user copying them from the source file
250      */
251     private boolean preserveAttributes(final Path path, final FileStatus refStat) {
252       FileStatus stat;
253       try {
254         stat = outputFs.getFileStatus(path);
255       } catch (IOException e) {
256         LOG.warn("Unable to get the status for file=" + path);
257         return false;
258       }
259 
260       try {
261         if (filesMode > 0 && stat.getPermission().toShort() != filesMode) {
262           outputFs.setPermission(path, new FsPermission(filesMode));
263         } else if (!stat.getPermission().equals(refStat.getPermission())) {
264           outputFs.setPermission(path, refStat.getPermission());
265         }
266       } catch (IOException e) {
267         LOG.error("Unable to set the permission for file=" + path, e);
268         return false;
269       }
270 
271       try {
272         String user = (filesUser != null) ? filesUser : refStat.getOwner();
273         String group = (filesGroup != null) ? filesGroup : refStat.getGroup();
274         if (!(user.equals(stat.getOwner()) && group.equals(stat.getGroup()))) {
275           outputFs.setOwner(path, user, group);
276         }
277       } catch (IOException e) {
278         LOG.error("Unable to set the owner/group for file=" + path, e);
279         return false;
280       }
281 
282       return true;
283     }
284 
285     private void copyData(final Context context,
286         final Path inputPath, final FSDataInputStream in,
287         final Path outputPath, final FSDataOutputStream out,
288         final long inputFileSize)
289         throws IOException {
290       final String statusMessage = "copied %s/" + StringUtils.humanReadableInt(inputFileSize) +
291                                    " (%.3f%%)";
292 
293       try {
294         byte[] buffer = new byte[BUFFER_SIZE];
295         long totalBytesWritten = 0;
296         int reportBytes = 0;
297         int bytesRead;
298 
299         while ((bytesRead = in.read(buffer)) > 0) {
300           out.write(buffer, 0, bytesRead);
301           totalBytesWritten += bytesRead;
302           reportBytes += bytesRead;
303 
304           if (reportBytes >= REPORT_SIZE) {
305             context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_COPIED).increment(reportBytes);
306             context.setStatus(String.format(statusMessage,
307                               StringUtils.humanReadableInt(totalBytesWritten),
308                               totalBytesWritten/(float)inputFileSize) +
309                               " from " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath);
310             reportBytes = 0;
311           }
312         }
313 
314         context.getCounter(Counter.BYTES_COPIED).increment(reportBytes);
315         context.setStatus(String.format(statusMessage,
316                           StringUtils.humanReadableInt(totalBytesWritten),
317                           totalBytesWritten/(float)inputFileSize) +
318                           " from " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath);
319 
320         // Verify that the written size match
321         if (totalBytesWritten != inputFileSize) {
322           String msg = "number of bytes copied not matching copied=" + totalBytesWritten +
323                        " expected=" + inputFileSize + " for file=" + inputPath;
324           throw new IOException(msg);
325         }
326       } catch (IOException e) {
327         LOG.error("Error copying " + inputPath + " to " + outputPath, e);
328         context.getCounter(Counter.COPY_FAILED).increment(1);
329         throw e;
330       }
331     }
332 
333     private FSDataInputStream openSourceFile(final Path path) {
334       try {
335         if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(path) || StoreFileInfo.isReference(path)) {
336           return new HFileLink(inputRoot, inputArchive, path).open(inputFs);
337         } else if (isHLogLinkPath(path)) {
338           String serverName = path.getParent().getName();
339           String logName = path.getName();
340           return new HLogLink(inputRoot, serverName, logName).open(inputFs);
341         }
342         return inputFs.open(path);
343       } catch (IOException e) {
344         LOG.error("Unable to open source file=" + path, e);
345         return null;
346       }
347     }
348 
349     private FileStatus getFileStatus(final FileSystem fs, final Path path) {
350       try {
351         if (HFileLink.isHFileLink(path) || StoreFileInfo.isReference(path)) {
352           HFileLink link = new HFileLink(inputRoot, inputArchive, path);
353           return link.getFileStatus(fs);
354         } else if (isHLogLinkPath(path)) {
355           String serverName = path.getParent().getName();
356           String logName = path.getName();
357           return new HLogLink(inputRoot, serverName, logName).getFileStatus(fs);
358         }
359         return fs.getFileStatus(path);
360       } catch (IOException e) {
361         LOG.warn("Unable to get the status for file=" + path);
362         return null;
363       }
364     }
365 
366     private FileChecksum getFileChecksum(final FileSystem fs, final Path path) {
367       try {
368         return fs.getFileChecksum(path);
369       } catch (IOException e) {
370         LOG.warn("Unable to get checksum for file=" + path, e);
371         return null;
372       }
373     }
374 
375     /**
376      * Check if the two files are equal by looking at the file length,
377      * and at the checksum (if user has specified the verifyChecksum flag).
378      */
379     private boolean sameFile(final FileStatus inputStat, final FileStatus outputStat) {
380       // Not matching length
381       if (inputStat.getLen() != outputStat.getLen()) return false;
382 
383       // Mark files as equals, since user asked for no checksum verification
384       if (!verifyChecksum) return true;
385 
386       // If checksums are not available, files are not the same.
387       FileChecksum inChecksum = getFileChecksum(inputFs, inputStat.getPath());
388       if (inChecksum == null) return false;
389 
390       FileChecksum outChecksum = getFileChecksum(outputFs, outputStat.getPath());
391       if (outChecksum == null) return false;
392 
393       return inChecksum.equals(outChecksum);
394     }
395 
396     /**
397      * HLog files are encoded as serverName/logName
398      * and since all the other files should be in /hbase/table/..path..
399      * we can rely on the depth, for now.
400      */
401     private static boolean isHLogLinkPath(final Path path) {
402       return path.depth() == 2;
403     }
404   }

406   /**
407    * Extract the list of files (HFiles/HLogs) to copy using Map-Reduce.
408    * @return list of files referenced by the snapshot (pair of path and size)
409    */
410   private List<Pair<Path, Long>> getSnapshotFiles(final FileSystem fs, final Path snapshotDir)
411       throws IOException {
412     SnapshotDescription snapshotDesc = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.readSnapshotInfo(fs, snapshotDir);
413 
414     final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files = new ArrayList<Pair<Path, Long>>();
415     final TableName table =
416         TableName.valueOf(snapshotDesc.getTable());
417     final Configuration conf = getConf();
418 
419     // Get snapshot files
420     SnapshotReferenceUtil.visitReferencedFiles(fs, snapshotDir,
421       new SnapshotReferenceUtil.FileVisitor() {
422         public void storeFile (final String region, final String family, final String hfile)
423             throws IOException {
424           Path path = HFileLink.createPath(table, region, family, hfile);
425           long size = new HFileLink(conf, path).getFileStatus(fs).getLen();
426           files.add(new Pair<Path, Long>(path, size));
427         }
428 
429         public void recoveredEdits (final String region, final String logfile)
430             throws IOException {
431           // copied with the snapshot referenecs
432         }
433 
434         public void logFile (final String server, final String logfile)
435             throws IOException {
436           long size = new HLogLink(conf, server, logfile).getFileStatus(fs).getLen();
437           files.add(new Pair<Path, Long>(new Path(server, logfile), size));
438         }
439     });
440 
441     return files;
442   }
443 
444   /**
445    * Given a list of file paths and sizes, create around ngroups in as balanced a way as possible.
446    * The groups created will have similar amounts of bytes.
447    * <p>
448    * The algorithm used is pretty straightforward; the file list is sorted by size,
449    * and then each group fetch the bigger file available, iterating through groups
450    * alternating the direction.
451    */
452   static List<List<Path>> getBalancedSplits(final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files, int ngroups) {
453     // Sort files by size, from small to big
454     Collections.sort(files, new Comparator<Pair<Path, Long>>() {
455       public int compare(Pair<Path, Long> a, Pair<Path, Long> b) {
456         long r = a.getSecond() - b.getSecond();
457         return (r < 0) ? -1 : ((r > 0) ? 1 : 0);
458       }
459     });
460 
461     // create balanced groups
462     List<List<Path>> fileGroups = new LinkedList<List<Path>>();
463     long[] sizeGroups = new long[ngroups];
464     int hi = files.size() - 1;
465     int lo = 0;
466 
467     List<Path> group;
468     int dir = 1;
469     int g = 0;
470 
471     while (hi >= lo) {
472       if (g == fileGroups.size()) {
473         group = new LinkedList<Path>();
474         fileGroups.add(group);
475       } else {
476         group = fileGroups.get(g);
477       }
478 
479       Pair<Path, Long> fileInfo = files.get(hi--);
480 
481       // add the hi one
482       sizeGroups[g] += fileInfo.getSecond();
483       group.add(fileInfo.getFirst());
484 
485       // change direction when at the end or the beginning
486       g += dir;
487       if (g == ngroups) {
488         dir = -1;
489         g = ngroups - 1;
490       } else if (g < 0) {
491         dir = 1;
492         g = 0;
493       }
494     }
495 
496     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
497       for (int i = 0; i < sizeGroups.length; ++i) {
498         LOG.debug("export split=" + i + " size=" + StringUtils.humanReadableInt(sizeGroups[i]));
499       }
500     }
501 
502     return fileGroups;
503   }
504 
505   private static Path getInputFolderPath(Configuration conf)
506       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
507     Path stagingDir = JobUtil.getStagingDir(conf);
508     return new Path(stagingDir, INPUT_FOLDER_PREFIX +
509       String.valueOf(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()));
510   }
511 
512   /**
513    * Create the input files, with the path to copy, for the MR job.
514    * Each input files contains n files, and each input file has a similar amount data to copy.
515    * The number of input files created are based on the number of mappers provided as argument
516    * and the number of the files to copy.
517    */
518   private static Path[] createInputFiles(final Configuration conf,
519       final List<Pair<Path, Long>> snapshotFiles, int mappers)
520       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
521     Path inputFolderPath = getInputFolderPath(conf);
522     FileSystem fs = inputFolderPath.getFileSystem(conf);
523     LOG.debug("Input folder location: " + inputFolderPath);
524 
525     List<List<Path>> splits = getBalancedSplits(snapshotFiles, mappers);
526     Path[] inputFiles = new Path[splits.size()];
527 
528     Text key = new Text();
529     for (int i = 0; i < inputFiles.length; i++) {
530       List<Path> files = splits.get(i);
531       inputFiles[i] = new Path(inputFolderPath, String.format("export-%d.seq", i));
532       SequenceFile.Writer writer = SequenceFile.createWriter(fs, conf, inputFiles[i],
533         Text.class, NullWritable.class);
534       LOG.debug("Input split: " + i);
535       try {
536         for (Path file: files) {
537           LOG.debug(file.toString());
538           key.set(file.toString());
539           writer.append(key, NullWritable.get());
540         }
541       } finally {
542         writer.close();
543       }
544     }
545 
546     return inputFiles;
547   }
548 
549   /**
550    * Run Map-Reduce Job to perform the files copy.
551    */
552   private boolean runCopyJob(final Path inputRoot, final Path outputRoot,
553       final List<Pair<Path, Long>> snapshotFiles, final boolean verifyChecksum,
554       final String filesUser, final String filesGroup, final int filesMode,
555       final int mappers) throws IOException, InterruptedException, ClassNotFoundException {
556     Configuration conf = getConf();
557     if (filesGroup != null) conf.set(CONF_FILES_GROUP, filesGroup);
558     if (filesUser != null) conf.set(CONF_FILES_USER, filesUser);
559     conf.setInt(CONF_FILES_MODE, filesMode);
560     conf.setBoolean(CONF_CHECKSUM_VERIFY, verifyChecksum);
561     conf.set(CONF_OUTPUT_ROOT, outputRoot.toString());
562     conf.set(CONF_INPUT_ROOT, inputRoot.toString());
563     conf.setInt("mapreduce.job.maps", mappers);
564 
565     Job job = new Job(conf);
566     job.setJobName("ExportSnapshot");
567     job.setJarByClass(ExportSnapshot.class);
568     TableMapReduceUtil.addDependencyJars(job);
569     job.setMapperClass(ExportMapper.class);
570     job.setInputFormatClass(SequenceFileInputFormat.class);
571     job.setOutputFormatClass(NullOutputFormat.class);
572     job.setMapSpeculativeExecution(false);
573     job.setNumReduceTasks(0);
574     for (Path path: createInputFiles(conf, snapshotFiles, mappers)) {
575       LOG.debug("Add Input Path=" + path);
576       SequenceFileInputFormat.addInputPath(job, path);
577     }
578 
579     return job.waitForCompletion(true);
580   }
581 
582   /**
583    * Execute the export snapshot by copying the snapshot metadata, hfiles and hlogs.
584    * @return 0 on success, and != 0 upon failure.
585    */
586   @Override
587   public int run(String[] args) throws Exception {
588     boolean verifyChecksum = true;
589     String snapshotName = null;
590     boolean overwrite = false;
591     String filesGroup = null;
592     String filesUser = null;
593     Path outputRoot = null;
594     int filesMode = 0;
595     int mappers = getConf().getInt("mapreduce.job.maps", 1);
596 
597     // Process command line args
598     for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
599       String cmd = args[i];
600       try {
601         if (cmd.equals("-snapshot")) {
602           snapshotName = args[++i];
603         } else if (cmd.equals("-copy-to")) {
604           outputRoot = new Path(args[++i]);
605         } else if (cmd.equals("-no-checksum-verify")) {
606           verifyChecksum = false;
607         } else if (cmd.equals("-mappers")) {
608           mappers = Integer.parseInt(args[++i]);
609         } else if (cmd.equals("-chuser")) {
610           filesUser = args[++i];
611         } else if (cmd.equals("-chgroup")) {
612           filesGroup = args[++i];
613         } else if (cmd.equals("-chmod")) {
614           filesMode = Integer.parseInt(args[++i], 8);
615         } else if (cmd.equals("-overwrite")) {
616           overwrite = true;
617         } else if (cmd.equals("-h") || cmd.equals("--help")) {
618           printUsageAndExit();
619         } else {
620           System.err.println("UNEXPECTED: " + cmd);
621           printUsageAndExit();
622         }
623       } catch (Exception e) {
624         printUsageAndExit();
625       }
626     }
627 
628     // Check user options
629     if (snapshotName == null) {
630       System.err.println("Snapshot name not provided.");
631       printUsageAndExit();
632     }
633 
634     if (outputRoot == null) {
635       System.err.println("Destination file-system not provided.");
636       printUsageAndExit();
637     }
638 
639     Configuration conf = getConf();
640     Path inputRoot = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
641     FileSystem inputFs = FileSystem.get(conf);
642     FileSystem outputFs = FileSystem.get(outputRoot.toUri(), conf);
643 
644     Path snapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, inputRoot);
645     Path snapshotTmpDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getWorkingSnapshotDir(snapshotName, outputRoot);
646     Path outputSnapshotDir = SnapshotDescriptionUtils.getCompletedSnapshotDir(snapshotName, outputRoot);
647 
648     // Check if the snapshot already exists
649     if (outputFs.exists(outputSnapshotDir)) {
650       if (overwrite) {
651         if (!outputFs.delete(outputSnapshotDir, true)) {
652           System.err.println("Unable to remove existing snapshot directory: " + outputSnapshotDir);
653           return 1;
654         }
655       } else {
656         System.err.println("The snapshot '" + snapshotName +
657           "' already exists in the destination: " + outputSnapshotDir);
658         return 1;
659       }
660     }
661 
662     // Check if the snapshot already in-progress
663     if (!overwrite && outputFs.exists(snapshotTmpDir)) {
664       System.err.println("A snapshot with the same name '" + snapshotName + "' may be in-progress");
665       System.err.println("Please check " + snapshotTmpDir + ". If the snapshot has completed, ");
666       System.err.println("consider removing " + snapshotTmpDir + " before retrying export");
667       return 1;
668     }
669 
670     // Step 0 - Extract snapshot files to copy
671     final List<Pair<Path, Long>> files = getSnapshotFiles(inputFs, snapshotDir);
672 
673     // Step 1 - Copy fs1:/.snapshot/<snapshot> to  fs2:/.snapshot/.tmp/<snapshot>
674     // The snapshot references must be copied before the hfiles otherwise the cleaner
675     // will remove them because they are unreferenced.
676     try {
677       FileUtil.copy(inputFs, snapshotDir, outputFs, snapshotTmpDir, false, overwrite, conf);
678     } catch (IOException e) {
679       System.err.println("Failed to copy the snapshot directory: from=" + snapshotDir +
680         " to=" + snapshotTmpDir);
681       e.printStackTrace(System.err);
682       return 1;
683     }
684 
685     // Step 2 - Start MR Job to copy files
686     // The snapshot references must be copied before the files otherwise the files gets removed
687     // by the HFileArchiver, since they have no references.
688     try {
689       if (files.size() == 0) {
690         LOG.warn("There are 0 store file to be copied. There may be no data in the table.");
691       } else {
692         if (!runCopyJob(inputRoot, outputRoot, files, verifyChecksum,
693             filesUser, filesGroup, filesMode, mappers)) {
694           throw new ExportSnapshotException("Snapshot export failed!");
695         }
696       }
697 
698       // Step 3 - Rename fs2:/.snapshot/.tmp/<snapshot> fs2:/.snapshot/<snapshot>
699       if (!outputFs.rename(snapshotTmpDir, outputSnapshotDir)) {
700         System.err.println("Snapshot export failed!");
701         System.err.println("Unable to rename snapshot directory from=" +
702                            snapshotTmpDir + " to=" + outputSnapshotDir);
703         return 1;
704       }
705       return 0;
706     } catch (Exception e) {
707       LOG.error("Snapshot export failed", e);
708       System.err.println("Snapshot export failed!");
709       e.printStackTrace(System.err);
710       outputFs.delete(outputSnapshotDir, true);
711       return 1;
712     }
713   }

715   // ExportSnapshot
716   private void printUsageAndExit() {
717     System.err.printf("Usage: bin/hbase %s [options]%n", getClass().getName());
718     System.err.println(" where [options] are:");
719     System.err.println("  -h|-help                Show this help and exit.");
720     System.err.println("  -snapshot NAME          Snapshot to restore.");
721     System.err.println("  -copy-to NAME           Remote destination hdfs://");
722     System.err.println("  -no-checksum-verify     Do not verify checksum.");
723     System.err.println("  -overwrite              Rewrite the snapshot manifest if already exists");
724     System.err.println("  -chuser USERNAME        Change the owner of the files to the specified one.");
725     System.err.println("  -chgroup GROUP          Change the group of the files to the specified one.");
726     System.err.println("  -chmod MODE             Change the permission of the files to the specified one.");
727     System.err.println("  -mappers                Number of mappers to use during the copy (mapreduce.job.maps).");
728     System.err.println();
729     System.err.println("Examples:");
730     System.err.println("  hbase " + getClass().getName() + " \\");
731     System.err.println("    -snapshot MySnapshot -copy-to hdfs://srv2:8082/hbase \\");
732     System.err.println("    -chuser MyUser -chgroup MyGroup -chmod 700 -mappers 16");
733     System.exit(1);
734   }
